divs: sighting detailslast evening as i was outside in my driveway talking to a friend on the phone, i looked in the sky to the north, and saw a very strange bright red light. it was moving to the northeast at a very slow rate, and was definately moving slower than any aircraft than i have ever seen. it seemed to flicker at times, but mostly was just a solid red\orange glow. at about 10:15 the sphere seemed to flash a little, and then a smaller sphere (same color as first) dropped from the first sphere and slowly descended to the ground. i lost sight of the smaller one as it dropped over the horizon. at that point the main sphere began to move in a more direct northwest direction, still moving slowly, and then it appeared to ascend for a second or two, then flashed bright white and dissapeared completely. i couldn't exactly determine how far this thing was, but it appeared to be between 5 to 10 miles away, and about 4000 feet above the ground. to say the least, it was a very strange event, and i have never seen anything like it before. i have attached pictures to this report, but they are from a digital camera, and not very close to the object. hopefully other people in this area saw the object as well. my wife took the photographs.
Summary: Bright Red Sphere moving slowly N/E then dropping smaller sphere.
